goals.description: Implement nutrient BMPs to reduce TN, TP and sediment in the watershed.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Nutrient BMPs will be implemented watershed...target both TN, TP and sediment reduction as soils in MS are known to have high phosphorus content.

goals.description: Achieve 50% fecal coliform reduction in Hickahala Creek and 70% in James Wolf Creek.
goals.objective: Mitigate pathogens and meet TMDL targets.
goals.targetArea: Hickahala Creek and James Wolf Creek sections
goals.sourceExcerpt: The Fecal Coliform TMDL...is calling for a 50% reduction...also calls for a 70% reduction in James Wolf Creek.

goals.description: Install BMPs (fencing, ponds, grade stabilization, etc.) prioritizing newly converted pasture areas.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues...BMPs will be prioritized for implementation in the newly converted pasture areas.

goals.description: Promote behavior changes and BMPs through education and outreach.
goals.objective: Improve water quality via community education.
goals.sourceExcerpt: The ultimate goal is to bring about behavior changes and the use of 'best management practices' that will improve water quality.

goals.description: Establish Watershed Implementation Team to refine the Watershed Based Plan.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Establish Watershed Implementation Team to begin refinement of Watershed Based Plan for Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed.

goals.description: Conduct baseline condition monitoring with historical and new data.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Initiate watershed monitoring Baseline condition monitoring Completed using historical data.

goals.description: Meet with landowners to secure commitment to install BMPs.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Meet with landowners and cooperators to secure commitments to install BMPs in priority areas.

goals.description: Establish routine meetings for the Team to support plan revision.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support WBP revision.

goals.description: Implement BMPs by schedule per TMDL and project requirements.
goals.objective: Install practices for nutrient, sediment, and pathogen problems.

goals.description: Coordinate to inspect BMPs installed with Section 319 funds.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Coordinate with Landowners to inspect BMPs that were installed using Section 319 funds.

goals.description: Begin monitoring to collect data on post-BMP water quality.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Begin monitoring to collect data on post-BMP water quality Post-BMP Monitoring Months 42-48.

goals.description: Finalize education/outreach plan and schedule events.
goals.sourceExcerpt: Finalize education and outreach plan Education/Outreach events scheduled Months 8-36.
Finalize revised WBP Final Revised WBP Months 30-36.

bmps.name: Fencing
bmps.description: Install fencing on pasturelands and grazing lands to limit livestock access to streams.
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

bmps.name: Watering Facilities
bmps.description: Install watering facilities such as tanks or troughs to provide alternative water sources for livestock, keeping them out of streams.
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

bmps.name: Heavy Use Area Protection
bmps.description: Provide protection for heavy use areas to reduce erosion and runoff from locations with high livestock traffic.
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

bmps.name: Ponds
bmps.description: Construct ponds to manage runoff and provide water for livestock away from streams.
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

bmps.name: Streambank and Shoreline Protection
bmps.description: Apply streambank and shoreline protection practices to stabilize banks and prevent erosion.
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

bmps.name: Grade Stabilization Structures
bmps.description: Install grade stabilization structures to reduce erosion (gully and slope stabilization).
priorityFactors: Likely water quality benefit
Willing landowners
Implementation of the recommendations of the TMDLs (this includes implementation of BMPs appropriate for nutrients, sediment, and pathogens)
Ease of showing effectiveness of the BMP(s) through monitoring
Shorter length of time for anticipated results (i.e., within the grant period)
bmps.excerpt: installation of the following BMPs would mitigate sediment and nutrient issues in the Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek watershed helping the stream recover: fencing, watering facilities, heavy use areas, ponds, streambank and shoreline protection, and grade stabilization structures.

implementation.description: Develop, execute, and implement a Subgrant Agreement that specifies the roles, tasks, requirements, and milestones for project implementation.
Facilitate meetings, media, and social media promotion of the project, and coordinate activities to fully implement this plan.
implementation.outcome: Public informed and project activities coordinated

implementation.description: Inform landowners and operators within the watershed about the project and work to secure commitments from priority area landowners and operators willing to participate.

Determine through GIS applications and intensive site surveys the priority areas within the sub-watershed that are contributing significant pollutant loads; install all BMPs in accordance with guidelines.
implementation.outcome: Priority areas identified and BMPs installed

implementation.description: Facilitate the completion and implementation of a plan to monitor baseline water quality conditions in the watershed and track changes resulting from BMPs.
implementation.outcome: Baseline and post-BMP water quality monitoring

implementation.description: Submit blank copies of standard maintenance agreements to MDEQ.
Conduct inspections of BMPs during construction.
Coordinate the collection of relevant GPS coordinates of all installed BMPs and incorporate this information into a GIS format.
Collect photo documentation before, during, and after installation of approved BMPs.
Report measured or estimated nonpoint source pollutant load reduction, acreage affected, pre-and post-site conditions, and GIS data.
implementation.outcome: Load reduction and site condition reports submitted

implementation.description: Establish Watershed Implementation Team to begin refinement of Watershed Based Plan.
Initiate watershed baseline monitoring using historical data.
Meet with landowners and cooperators to secure commitments to install BMPs in priority areas.
Establish routine meeting schedule for WIT to support watershed plan revision.
implementation.outcome: WIT meetings held and plan revisions supported

implementation.description: Begin monitoring to collect data on post-BMP water quality.
Finalize education and outreach plan and schedule education/outreach events.
implementation.outcome: Education/outreach events scheduled and outreach plan finalized

monitoring.description: Pre-implementation (baseline) monitoring using chemical and biological sampling data to assess stream condition before BMP installation.
monitoring.indicator: M-BISQ score; other chemical and biological parameters
monitoring.method: Standard Operating Procedures; agency Quality Assurance protocols

thresholds.description: M-BISQ score 10 points below attainment threshold for West Bioregion

sampleLocations: Historical monitoring stations on Basket Creek and Hickahala Creek

monitoring.description: Post-BMP monitoring to assess water quality changes downstream of BMP activity, compared to baseline data.
monitoring.indicator: M-BISQ score; chemical and biological parameters
monitoring.method: Best professional judgement for station selection; SOPs; agency QA protocols
monitoring.frequency: At least 1 year post-BMP, possibly up to 5 or more years
sampleLocations: Locations downstream of BMP activity (to be selected)
monitoring.sampleSchedule: Initiated after BMP installation and stream stabilization, repeated annually or as needed

outreach.name: Watershed Education and Outreach
outreach.description: Conduct workshops, field days, and community events to educate the public on water quality and BMPs.

partners.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District

outreach.indicators: Number of events, attendance, survey results

events.audience: Soil and Water districts, Extension Service

geographicAreas.name: Basket Creek-Hickahala Creek Watershed
geographicAreas.description: Watershed located in Tate County, Mississippi, with diverse land use including cropland, forest, and pasture/grass.

organizations.name: Mississippi Soil and Water Conservation Commission
Tate County Soil and Water Conservation District
